climbs.name: Just Gror A Pair
climbs.fa: Chris Hirsch, Harrison Teuber - Ground up 8/15

content.description:
Great long face pitch protected mostly by natural gear! This one will test your route finding skills. 

  Starts at the hand pod and up to the obvious undercling. Right trending line past the mini roofs and flakes that will eventually take you back left towards the notch. Stem up the notch until you can pull onto the taller summit, awesome finish!
content.protection: Doubles to bd3, nuts/rps   a lot of slings and a couple double lengths will help rope drag   3 bolts   Straddle and sling the summit with cord, there is a spot for a bd .4 if you'd like
content.location: N face of Gror   NSR. One climber will rap the route, other will do a short rap down the south side and walk around. 60m rope will work

content.description: Hike past Riddle and go over the shoulder and follow the trail as it descends down a gully. This will be the thrid? formation on your right. Â Go into the Gully on your right and look on the left hand side you will see a overhang on the end. Just past this on the left you will see an obvious crack seam. This is the route. Follows up through the bulges places gear low and a decent runout on small gear in the middle. Pulling the Second upper bulge is the crux and is committing and run out once you leave the crack to the top there is no gear really. You can get a few small pieces in if you look. Was an anchor on the northside
content.protection: Standard Rack with small gear   NSR off summit
content.location: In the Gulley on the left hand side Look for the obvious crack.

content.description: Formation to the north of East Lies Iron Hills and the last? formation on the RIGHT hand side of the trail when heading to Middle Earth. Good quality Rock. From research I believe Pete D. and Paul Muehl got the FA. They have a lone route up the shorter side that has old button heads on it.
